item.description:
Please help turn a "problem into a solution" this week and come to Willard Beach in South Portland (although other local beaches might be good sources as well) to collect some seaweed for your garden or farm.

We've gotten confirmation from local officials that you can come to Willard Beach, park in the parking lot on Willow Street and bring buckets or a wheelbarrow down to the beach to get some!!!  They are inundated with seaweed in the wake of recent storms so now is great time to collect.

Seaweed can be used as mulch (alone or as a layer in sheet mulching), worked through your compost pile or your chicken run, or as a top dressing around plants.  No need to rinse the salt off either.  Seaweed is a mineral rich product used in soil building for hundreds - if not thousands - of years.

 

This is an "open event" with no specific open or close date and time.  Just go for it!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Seaweed Collection for Farm & Garden (Come When You Can)
